text:
Hi Jarl! 
Thats such great news! Congratulations!!!:dizzy::dizzy::dizzy::dizzy: Whats his name? 
I can imagine the stress but actually it is good that you are forced to stay at home so you can spend time with both of them. Thats great :grinning:. I am healthy and good as well thanks, as well as my family and friends. I am currently staying at a friend’s place in London so luckily have company.

Being put in furlough means you are not going to work but still receive a salary? We were offered that at the company but unfortunately I’m not elegible... What they did at Goodbye Kansas is reduce our working days and salary to an 80%. Most people were not very happy, I think personally it’s my best bet being new in the company.
I started and 2 weeks later we were sent home, so didn’t get a chance to meet people much and get used to the workflow, but I’m putting all my efforts to keep up and having meetings every day with my manager. It is a tricky situation though because there is not a lot of work to be done..

Its great that you are managing to update your showreel as well! I am a bit concerned about the situation since I am still on my probation period (it ends first days of June) and don’t know how much in need I will be when we go back to the office.. I am kind of preparing for the worst and trying to learn as much as posible in case things go south
